See also: juli, julí, júlí, and jùlí

Catalan[edit]

Etymology[edit]

From Latin Iūlius.

Pronunciation[edit]

  • (Balearic, Central) IPA(key): /ˈʒu.li/
  • (Valencian) IPA(key): /ˈd͡ʒu.li/

Proper noun[edit]

Juli m

  1. A male given name originating from Latin, equivalent to English Julius

German[edit]

Alternative forms[edit]

  • Julei (almost exclusively in speech; in order to better distinguish from Juni)

Pronunciation[edit]

  • IPA(key): /ˈjuːli/
  • audio
    		(file)

Noun[edit]

Juli m (genitive Julis or Juli, plural Julis)

  1. July

Declension[edit]

Declension of Juli
singularplural
indef.def.noundef.noun
nominativeeinderJulidieJulis
genitiveeinesdesJulis,
Juli		derJulis
dativeeinemdemJulidenJulis
accusativeeinendenJulidieJulis

Synonyms[edit]

  • Heumonat (archaic)

Indonesian[edit]

Indonesian Wikipedia has an article on:
Juli
Wikipedia id

Etymology[edit]

From Dutch juli, from Latin iūlius, from Iuppiter, from Proto-Indo-European *dyeu-pəter-.

Pronunciation[edit]

  • IPA(key): /ˈd͡ʒu.li/
  • Hyphenation: Ju‧li

Proper noun[edit]

Juli

  1. July

Alternative forms[edit]

  • Julai (Standard Malay)

Coordinate terms[edit]

  • (months) bulan-bulan: Januari, Februari, Maret, April, Mei, Juni, Juli, Agustus, September, Oktober, November, Desember

Further reading[edit]

  • “Juli” in Kamus Besar Bahasa Indonesia (KBBI) Daring, Jakarta: Badan Pengembangan dan Pembinaan Bahasa, Kementerian Pendidikan dan Kebudayaan Republik Indonesia, 2016.

Luxembourgish[edit]

Pronunciation[edit]

  • IPA(key): /ˈjuːli/, /ˈʒuːli/

Proper noun[edit]

Juli m

  1. July
